title: Arkansas loses 27-14 to Alabama after leading at the half
text:
Arkansas loses 27-14 to Alabama after leading at the half Published 9:36 PM CDT Oct 10, 2015 Photos 
Arkansas loses 27-14 to Alabama on the Crimson Tide homecoming after leading at the half. 
The first half saw a clash of iron wills between the best rushing offense in the league and the best run-stopping defense that created a low-scoring 30 minutes. 
Alabama got on the board first after the Hogs defense forced a field goal attempt on 4th and goal. 
On their next drive, the Hogs forced another field goal attempt from Adam Griffith. This time the one from 25 yards out was no good. 
Two the next three Tide possessions ended in Arkansas turnovers. The first one came when Josh Liddell intercepted Jake Coker. The Razorbacks couldn't do anything with that drive and had to punt it back to Bama. With under five minutes in the half, Coker's cannon got him in trouble again. Santos Ramirez jumped up for the pass at the Alabama 42-yard line. He returned it for 18 yards and then the Crimson Tide got called for unsportsmanlike conduct, putting the Hogs on the 12-yard line. This time, Brandon Allen came through for his defense, finding a wide open Drew Morgan to give Arkansas the lead at 7-3. 
Nick Saban gave Griffith a chance to shrink the gap before the half, but the 48-yard attempt missed wide right. 
Arkansas went into the half leading by four. 
The second half saw more of the same from two defenses that weren't willing to give up a yard without a fight. 
With a little under two minutes to go in the third, Coker found a hole in the Arkansas secondary. He hit a wide open Calvin Ridley for the 81-yard touchdown to put Bama up 10-7. 
The Hogs offense couldn't find any firepower during their possession so the Tide got it back on Arkansas' 43-yard line. 
From there, it was almost all Alabama, they add another two touchdowns and a field goal to make it 27-7. 
Allen finds Reed with 1:37 left in the fourth for a long touchdown to make it 27-14, but it was too little too late for the Hogs to pull off the upset. 
No. 8 Crimson Tide win their homecoming game, 27-14.
